subject: Re: FW: (Important) Wordpress
preview: Hi Nansi,  We’ve successfully updated WooCommerce to the latest version (10.04) on the live site after testing it on staging. Everything is running smoothly.  A few notes on plugin licences: There a

full_threads.body:
Hi Nansi,

We’ve successfully updated WooCommerce to the latest version (10.04) on the live site after testing it on staging. Everything is running smoothly.

A few notes on plugin licences:
  • There are several premium plugins that were originally purchased as part of the website build.
  • These are still working properly, so Aussie Industries doesn’t need to renew them unless updates are necessary.
  • We’ve included two of them in the WooCommerce update using the original build licence, so no additional costs were incurred this time.

Here’s a breakdown:
  • WooCommerce Zapier
    Licence expires in October 2025. It will continue working as-is. If you’d like to upgrade after expiry, it would cost $150/year.
  • WooCommerce Customer/Order/Coupon Export
    Licence expires in November 2025. Same as above—it will keep functioning, and upgrades would cost $150/year.
  • NAB Transact
    This plugin's licence has already expired. It's still working fine, and the changes in the latest version are minimal. If you do want to upgrade, the cost is $120/year.

Recommendation:

No immediate action is needed but let us know if you’d like to proceed with any of these renewals (total would be $420/year), or if you prefer that we continue to monitor and only flag updates when they’re essential.

Happy to help you avoid unnecessary costs if everything is working well for now.

What additional costs are we potentially looking at ? if it optimises functions then I'd like you to put forward a price for the changes and the benefits

Thanks



Nansi Philips

Operations Manager

t: 1300 11 00 11
|

Hi @andy,

Quick update—I was able to access the latest versions of the paid plugins through Heath’s WooCommerce account:

  • (Able to update) WooCommerce Zapier – $150/year – expires Oct 29, 2025
  • (Able to update) WooCommerce Customer/Order/Coupon Export – $120/year – expires Nov 21, 2025
  • (Remaining Update) NAB Transact – $120/year – expired on Oct 6, 2024
    • Current Version 2.5.21 and Update version is 2.5.23.

There’s no record of Nansi having paid for these via Chargebee, and nothing from Heath indicating they were scoped separately—so I’m assuming they were likely included in the original quote.
Here are a couple of options:
Option 1:
We go ahead and renew the WooCommerce NAB Transact Gateway plugin now ($120/year), since it’s the primary payment gateway for Aussieindustries, and flag to Nansi that she’ll be responsible for this one—and future renewals—moving forward.

Option 2:
We leave it as-is for now, since there are no critical updates, and revisit if anything changes.

let me know what you think?

Thankyou Andy,

Please let me know once all updates are completed



Nansi Philips

Operations Manager

Hi @joel,

I looked into it and it doesn’t appear that they’ve paid for any plugins through us. There was one instance where they provided the plugin themselves. They seem to be on a monthly subscription for Smart Reviews via Chargebee, but I’m not certain whether the plugin itself is included in that or managed separately.

Thanks!

Hi @andy,

I have updated the email below, but I want to check with @victoriaV if the Heath was previously charge them with the premium plugins and also i want to confirm if they are on smart reviews and if the plugin is included to the payment of smart reviews.

Hi Nansi,

Just a quick heads-up—we’ve updated WooCommerce on the live site with the latest version, and everything is running smoothly.

There are a few premium plugins that also require updates. Here’s a quick overview:
  • WooCommerce NAB Transact Gateway – $79/year
    Recommended: This is the main payment gateway for the site, so keeping it updated is important.
  • WooCommerce Zapier – $99/year
    Used to connect WooCommerce with Zapier, which then passes data through to LeadConnector.
  • WooCommerce Customer/Order/Coupon Export – $79/year
    Used to export order data when needed.

Let us know if you'd like to go ahead with any of these.

If everything’s working fine for now, we’re also happy to hold off and help avoid unnecessary costs.

Thanks @joel - feedback here. Lets be clear if these are new costs or increments and why needed.

hi @andy, I have updated the woocommerce. I've created a draft as well.

Hi Nansi,

Just a quick heads-up, we’ve updated WooCommerce on the live site and everything is running smoothly.

There are a few additional premium plugins that also require updates. These aren’t included in the core update and would need your approval to proceed, as they’ll be charged to your card:
  • WooCommerce Customer/Order/Coupon Export – $79/year
  • WooCommerce NAB Transact Gateway – $79/year
  • WooCommerce Zapier – $99/year, or $158.40 for 2 years

Let us know if you'd like to go ahead with any of these.

If everything’s working fine for now, we’re happy to leave them as is to avoid unnecessary costs.

@joel - what are the associated costs and can we get away with updating WooCommerce without additional costs?

If not, please get @victoriaV to email Nansi with the proposal and costs for her approval. 🙏

full_threads.body:
This ticket has been idle for over 24 hours.

If you need to respond to the client, please create a new conversation and close this ticket. Once the new ticket is created, continue the conversation there.

For guidance, refer to this walkthrough:

@andy Do we have a go ahead to purchase the plugins? we will perform the plugin updates on staging first.

I called Nansi to talk it through. I think we're good here.

Dialpad Summary
Andy calls Nansi to discuss an email about updates to a custom-built website. They emphasize the need for careful handling of updates due to the site's custom code, which could break if not managed properly. Andy explains that updates are usually done monthly but are more delicate due to the custom code. They discuss the need for upgrades in certain areas and the importance of not updating unless necessary. Nansi reassures Andy that no updates have been done without their permission and agrees to the planned update next week. The call ends on a positive note.

Hi Nansi,

Thanks for your message - I understand how that could seem like we dropped the ball.

Just to clarify:
  • Aussie Industries has a bunch of custom code, so we take extra precautions to ensure updates don’t accidentally break any functionality.
  • Woocommerce specifically needs to be done very carefully through the staging environment first to prevent any issues on the live site and customer checkouts
    • Other plugins like Rank Math SEO, TablePress, Theme and WordPress Core updates have all be done and current
  • Some updates also involve additional cost (e.g. WooCommerce Zapier, NAB Transact Gateway, and Export plugins) so unless something is broken or not working, we seek to minimize costs. For example
    • WooCommerce Customer/Order/Coupon Export'
    • WooCommerce NAB Transact Gateway
    • WooCommerce Zapier

We’re happy to update our internal to make sure the WooCommerce-specific updates are surfaced and prioritized earlier moving forward for Aussie Industries.

We will proceed with updating these next week and confirm once done.
Let me send this out now.

Hi @allieB,

I think this should be fine.

Here are the paid plugins as well
WooCommerce Customer/Order/Coupon Export
WooCommerce NAB Transact Gateway
WooCommerce Zapier

Hey @joel please check my draft

Hi Nansi,

Thanks for your message—and I completely understand your frustration here.

I’m really sorry this wasn’t proactively flagged from our side.

Just to clarify what’s happened:
  • We were already working on these plugin updates except for the woocommerce since we are doing it carefully through the staging environment first to prevent any issues on your live site.
  • Your site has custom code, so we take extra precautions to ensure updates don’t accidentally break any functionality.
  • It just so happened we hadn’t completed the full QA when your agency flagged it—appreciate them bringing it to attention.

Quick heads-up:
  • Some of these updates may involve additional cost (e.g. WooCommerce Zapier, NAB Transact Gateway, and Export plugins). We’ll confirm before going ahead with anything chargeable.

We’re also reviewing our internal processes to make sure WooCommerce-specific updates like these are surfaced and prioritized earlier moving forward.

Let us know how you’d like to proceed, and we’ll get on it right away.
